definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: You could put on a small circus inside a 747-8.
sentences.chinese: 你甚至可以在里面塞下一个小型马戏团。

sentences.english: Well, I know this duck that could be just brilliant in your circus.
sentences.chinese: 我认识一只鸭子，在你们马戏团肯定出彩。

sentences.english: I will join a circus and fly away on a flying trapeze.
sentences.chinese: 我就要变成马戏团里的空中飞人，飞得高高的。

sentences.english: The acrobats got warmed up before the circus show.
sentences.chinese: 特技表演家在马戏团开始前做些练习。

sentences.english: The circus experienced a calamity when the tigers escaped from their cages.
sentences.chinese: 当老虎从笼子里逃出来时，马戏团经历了一场灾难。

sentences.english: As the star of a circus, Boog has lived a luxurious life.
sentences.chinese: 身为马戏团的大明星，布榖过着十分奢华的生活。

sentences.english: "Geek" is the circus guy who bites the head off of live animals.
sentences.chinese: “怪咖”是在马戏团中把动物的头要下来的人。

sentences.english: He's an animal trainer at the circus.

sentences.chinese: 他是个旧式的马戏团揽客者。

sentences.english: The team performs under a circus tent.
sentences.chinese: 这队在马戏团帐篷下演出。
“只在马戏团里看过，”弗洛西说。

sentences.english: After lunch Jack went out and wandered slowly round the circus tent.
sentences.chinese: 午饭后，杰克走了出去，绕着马戏团的帐篷慢慢晃悠。

sentences.english: The circus placarded the city with advertisements.
Very amusing. Mazaa aa gaya. I think this report will get the top honours in Comedy Circus.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这份报告在马戏团喜剧表演中能获得最高荣誉。

sentences.english: For the moment he was working as actor and horse-rider with the circus.
sentences.chinese: 眼下，他在这家马戏团当演员跑马。

sentences.english: Cirque du Soleil sold 200,000 tickets within 24 hours of putting them on sale.
sentences.chinese: 太阳马戏团在24小时内卖出了推出的20万张门票。

definition: Charlie Chaplin (1899-1977), English movie actor and director
Carmen (name)/Carmen, 1875 opera by Georges Bizet 比才 based on novel by Prosper Mérimée 梅里美[Mei2 li3 mei3]
to act (in a play)/to perform/to put on (a performance)/performance/concert/show/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]
